channel.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt]Prerequisite[/size][/center]
You will require a Facebook account for testing. This challenge has to do with the Graffiti Facebook application at http://www.facebook.com/graffitiwall It will automate the drawing process to the canvas from an input image.
[center][size=15pt]Requirements[/size][/center]
[ul][li]Source code included[/li] [li]Be able to take an image at runtime to draw[/li] [li]Draw the image to the Graffiti canvas[/li] [li]Support differences in Graffiti canvas locations on screen[/li][/ul]
[center][size=15pt]Users who have completed the challenge[/size][/center]
Have fun! Once you're done, simply post it and I'll add you to the list.
Example: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1ld7T15Af4&feature=related

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Looks like an interesting challenge, if graffiti stops being a bitch for me I might try it.

Read full topic

@Mopman wrote:

He doesn’t mind which programming language is used (I asked yesterday)

Read full topic

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

Is there any type of reward? Honestly this sounds like a pretty interesting challenge, my question is does the programming language matter?

And this sounds extremely easy since you can just set the size to 1 or 2 pixels with full opacity and scan/draw 1 pixel at a time, which would be very easy, but when watching the graffiti app re-draw it, it would look pretty lame lol

Read full topic

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Do whatever you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:1, topic:303296”][ul][li]Be able to take an image at runtime to draw[/li][/ul][/quote] care to elaborate? you mean be able to select any image from your file system and draw it on the graffiti canvas, or what?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2009, 07:35:52 am[/size][hr]regarding the actual drawing onto the graffiti canvas, can it take control of the mouse? or should it send fake mouse events and such?

Read full topic

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Does it need to seem human (since you can replay how it was drawn)?

Read full topic

item.title: Graffiti Programming Challenge
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:6, topic:303296”]ill give it a try, with the second requirement you mean like a runtime arg?[/quote]I think he means some way of browsing and selecting an image to be drawn, in other words some userfriendly approach. That’s how I interpret it anyway.

Read full topic
